items.content_html:
FF133 implements TrustedTypePolicyFactory.getPropertyType and TrustedTypePolicyFactory.getAttributeType() behind a preference

This adds an experimental feature section.

Note, this is a non-useful subset of functionality for using the trusted types API, with a lot more to follow. For that reason I have chosen NOT to put it in the release not - we don't want to highlight it. I could have chosen not to add to experimental features also, but I think it is useful to have a placeholder to track what is being done here.

Related docs work can be tracked in #36559
items.title: FF133 Expr. Features - TrustedTypePolicyFactory.getPropertyType, .getAttributeType pref

items.content_html:
The beforetoggle and toggle events belong to HTMLElement and are inherited by other elements, but they fire only at specific elements such as dialog, popover, details.

So they are quite important in dialog, popover, details but because we don't document inherited events/api thingies in the derived class, and because these are only fired on some classes, there is no real obvious hint in those pages that they exist or whether they are supported in a particular browser - i.e. you wouldn't know to look at those events, and to check for support in the specific element.

SO this adds special BCD keys for each event to their respective pages, giving the compatibility story visibility at the place where it matters.

Note, that the BCD only just went in for this, so doesn't render yet.

Related docs work in #36536
items.title: FF133 Compat data for inherited toggle/beforetoggle to dialog, popover, details APIs

items.content_html:
Description

see spec at https://drafts.css-houdini.org/css-paint-api/ and https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/canvas.html

note that the filter property though not included in the spec (neither included nor exluded), the chromium has implemented this, see https://github.com/chromium/chromium/blob/main/third_party/blink/renderer/modules/csspaint/paint_rendering_context_2d.idl#L33

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests

part of the mdn/mdn#516
items.title: Add docs for `PaintRenderingContext2D`

items.content_html:
Description

This pull request addresses Issue #36702 by updating the documentation for the <title> element to clarify that HTML tags within the <title> are treated as plain text and not parsed as HTML.

Motivation

This change ensures developers understand the behavior when using HTML tags in the <title>.

Additional details

Issue #36702

Related issues and pull requests

Fixes #36702
items.title: Fix: Clarify behavior of HTML tags within the <title> element (Issue #36702)

items.content_html:
What information was incorrect, unhelpful, or incomplete?

had "option(value=val*)= val" in two spots

What did you expect to see?
needs to be "option(value=val*) #{val}" for the combo box options to display properly

Closes #36816
items.title: Update index.md | update bookinstance.js code sample

items.content_html:
Description

Update the official status of Accept-Charset header field.

Motivation

While reading through RFC 9110 and looking for header field information on MDN, I noticed that the header was officially deprecated in 2022, and I would like MDN to reflect the change in RFC.

Additional details

RFC 9110 section 12.5.2 Accept-Charset

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: docs: update Accept-Charset status

items.content_html: Ref: whatwg/html#4770
items.title: valueAsDate: unsupported on Chrome for datetime-local

items.content_html: part of openwebdocs/project#214
items.title: New page: htmlareaelement.coords and shape

items.content_html:
Description

The current text says you can omit the removalOptions object. This is not the case, both Firefox and Chrome will throw an error if you do not pass an empty object to the function. I have changed the text to make this clear.

Motivation

It is false information that lead me to write failing code.

Additional details

I unfortunately cannot find any documentation on these APIs, but I have manually tested that this is the case in Firefox 132 and Chrome 130.

The example in this text also passes an empty object.

Related issues and pull requests

Slightly related: #27629
items.title: browsingData.removeCache: removalOptions is not optional

items.content_html:
Description

Removes a few redirects into translated content that use targets with translated slugs, are outdated and/or invalid.
(MP-1719)

Motivation

rari/yari parity, rari does run consistency checks on redirects.
items.title: removes redirects that use localized slugs into translated content

items.content_html:
Description

Adds the HTML comment syntax to the page title, and fixes the sidebar.

Motivation

The HTML comment page was added in August 2024, but it cannot be found when searching for <!-- by folks who don't know what these stand for. Adding the syntax is similar to the Non-capturing group: (?:...) page:

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests

Partially resolves mdn/yari#8921.
items.title: fix(html/comments): update title + fix sidebar

items.content_html:
FF133 supports the fetch() init option keepalive by default, along with same init/property value in Response.
This adds a release note, removes from experimental features.

It also tweaks the docs. The change is relatively subtle. The original presented this as:

  1. A mechanism for sending analytics in a page that might be closing/being navigated from
  2. An alternative to sendBeacon for this purpose, with advantages.

The new version presents the first point as a "for example" - presumably it might have other use cases.
Then continues to present sendBeacon.

Related docs work can be tracked in #36537
items.title: FF133 Relnote/docs: fetch keepalive

items.content_html:
The Performance.getEntries() returns a name value that is a URL for entries of type "navigation". The spec has always said this should strip out fragment directives, of which the only type I know if is text directives.
Firefox 133 now does this, matching Safari 18,

This adds a release note and a few updates to the PerformanceNavigationTiming to mention that fragment directives are omitted. Note that you might argue this is not necessary to mention because it is in the spec/is a bug. I'm adding it because this was not obvious in at least two browser implementations (hence the fix) and it is going to break some libraries.

Related docs work can be tracked in #36546
items.title: FF133 Navigation Timing API  omits test fragments in URL

items.content_html:
FF133 adds support for ServiceWorkerContainer to be exposed in workers via WorkerNavigator.serviceWorker in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1113522

This adds the release note.

Related docs work can be tracked in #36532
items.title: FF133 ServiceWorkerContainer now available in Workers

items.content_html:
Safari 18.2 supports the newly defined CSS inline layout properties. Updating the module landing page to remove "not supported in any browser" as that will no longer be true.

do not merge until 18.2 is released.
items.title: CSS module: create links for future pages (Safari 18.2)

items.content_html:
This PR implements the proposal in https://github.com/orgs/mdn/discussions/756.

It adds a section to https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Content-Security-Policy that documents all the source expression values, and links to the relevant bits of this section from the fetch directive pages.

For the new section (https://pr36792.content.dev.mdn.mozit.cloud/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Content-Security-Policy#source_expression_syntax) I wasn't sure how to order values. I don't think alphabetical is a good idea.

Commits:

  • b40201e
    • Add a section on fallbacks
    • Add a section documenting all source expression values, that can be referenced by fetch directive pages
    • Remove existing "Values" section as this is all covered by the new section
  • e6e58cd
    • List source expression values for directives that just have the basic 3 types.
  • d9bf136
    • List source expression values for default-src, script-src*, and style-src*
  • 7ff0de2
    • List source expression values for fenced-frame-src. I haven't changed what it actually says although I don't really understand it. But I can't find any docs for this directive and it isn't in the CSP spec, so I'm not really able to sort it out.
  • e4ee4d0
    • Updated 'self' to note insecure upgrade behavior, part of the fix for #36168.
  • d5132f2
    • Delete the old "source values" doc and update broken links.

Fixes #36168.
items.title: Update CSP source expression reference

items.content_html:
Description

I'm not entirely sure what the preëxisting example intended to demonstrate, so I changed it and its description to illustrate the spec quoted right above it. Let me know if there's some aspect of the spec that this example doesn't cover.

Motivation

As it stands, I find the second example a bit confusing.

Additional details

Relevant section of the CSS flexbox specification in the Editors’ Draft and the published CR.
items.title: Clarify interaction between collapsing and multi-line containers

items.content_html:
Description

Following the discussion in w3c/manifest#1147 and confirmation from spec editors, this PR updates:

  • scope page:

    • Improves the description of scope fallback behavior.
    • Removes the statement about the requirement of start_url to be within scope.

  • start_url page:

    • Reorders sentences in the "Values" section for better flow.
    • Moves the same-origin information from "Values" to "Description" - it is not a requirement to be met, rather how start_url is processed in relation to the installation page. This has been explained in the "Description" section along with an example.
items.title: docs(manifest): Update `start_url` and `scope` pages based on document URL clarifications
